Reviews.Title: “Older but Very Accomodating”
Reviews.Author: rolyholmes
Reviews.Content: We booked the room on points and were upgraded to the executive king suite with Melody at the front desk working her charm with the best western rewards people. Can't stress how accomodating the front desk people were with recommendations for meals and sites to see. Big room, no need for air conditioning with fresh night and morning air coming in through our open windows. Surprising quiet being just off a busy street. The lights at corner have a red light camera on them we were informed with a possibility of a $400 fine. So behave yourself there. Had breakfast at the Napa General Store. Best scrambled eggs with local goat cheese, spinach and bacon ever. Well worth going to. There is also an outlet mall to the northwest of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok place for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: UmaKS
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located at the absolute south end of the town of Napa and the down town area where all the fun places and restaurants are is about 10 mins drive from here. We stayed at the hotel on a Saturday nite in a double double room that was a little noisy as we were located right off the door opening into the outdoor corridor leading to the elevator.. The beds were comfortable and the room was very clean but with a slightly outdated decor. There was also a small balcony overlooking the pool. The room was equipped with a coffee maker and a refrigerator. The bathroom was a little small but clean. The check in/ check out was very smooth and since we are Best Western Rewards members we were given a small bag containing complimentary bottled waters and some snacks which was a nice touch. A point to note is that the hotel offers no breakfast, except some fresh fruit and granola bars and coffee in the lobby. But the Denny attached to the property will offer a 15% discount if you are hotel guests.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Pet Friendly & Great Service”
Reviews.Author: starsher
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice and plan to stay again soon. We like everything about place. It's quiet clean and there is a nice patio for our dog. The staff is always friend and helpful. The beds comfortable and showers have good water pressure.

Reviews.Title: “Staff great, room huge, location.. umm.. mehhh”
Reviews.Author: arad85
Reviews.Content: This place is on the corner of two busy roads. The restaurant is a Dennys (that doesn't serve alcohol!!) and it's relatively noisy. Plus points (for us) were a huge room, great aircon and a pool/hot tub area that worked for us. We were sightseeing, booked a couple of days in advance so had limited choice. Bed very comfy, room great, close to petrol (gas) that we needed desperately and close to Napa Valley. Nothing more to say really...

Reviews.Title: “Pleased with the service and great prices!”
Reviews.Author: Shoshonechic
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Inn at the Vines had great service! The front desk clerks gave us maps, tips, two-for-one coupons, and even shared her favorite places to visit. Not to mention a complementary bottle of Napa Valley wine. (It was a tripadvisor special!) The beds were on the firmer side but had plenty of fluffy pillows. The rooms are large, clean, and have mini-refrigerators. We gazed longingly at the steamy hot tub but were too tired to make the effort. Breakfast was not really breakfast but coffee, fruit, and a granola bar. I was happy for coffee! The best part of this visit was the price of a room with two beds was $115, which is amazing for Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Best Western!”
Reviews.Author: DavenChictown
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at the Best Western and have no complaints at all! The room was quite spacious and very clean. Had a great view from the second floor room. Everything was updated. Very pleasant and friendly staff at check-in and check-out! If ever fornunate to get back to "wine country", another stay at this property will be a must!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel on our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: brandyb4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Plus inn at the Vines during our northern California honeymoon. It was the nicest hotel we stayed in. Everything in the room was updated, giant TV, great wireless, nice bathroom, loved the king sized bed and all the pillows. We did not want to leave! I would suggest putting wine glasses in the rooms, it is wine country after all!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Napa”
Reviews.Author: RWells5733
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel after a couple of nights at the Best Western premier in Napa, we wanted to compare the two properties. Plus vs. Premier hotel. This was by far a better hotel that it's upscale relative. The location is close to anything you might need. The BW Premier up the highway had nothing nearby other than a very bad mexican restaraunt. The rooms in this hotel are large and have great furnishings for a hotel of this scale. The hotel is directly across from a large shopping center, and directly next to a chain restaraunt. Parking is spread out, but not a real problem. We stayed here on the opening week of Football season this year and asked for a room with a larger TV. The front desk was very friendly and upgraded us to a suit. The suit was two stories with a great bed and a great TV. We will definatly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: dreambigger
Reviews.Content: For the money it was a very pleasant stay. Rooms were updated, clean and quiet. The staff was exceptionally helpful. They made suggestions and even opened our bottle of wine. During checkout they held our wine purchases for the shipping company to pick up. Give it a try!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean hotel for exploring Napa”
Reviews.Author: Cincinnatus1
Reviews.Content: Overview: The Best Western Inn at the Vines is a clean, comfortable, basic hotel in a good location for exploring Napa and Sonoma. If you want something posh, look elsewhere. However, if you are looking for a good value and a comfortable room, the Vines is a solid choice. Facilities: The hotel's facilities are fairly limited. There is a small outdoor pool and a nice hot tub. Towels are available poolside. There are no workout facilities. The breakfast provided is limited... coffee, granola bars, and fruit is available by the check-in desk for you to grab and go. There is also a discount for guests at the Denny's next to the hotel. Rooms: The rooms look to have been renovated in recent years, though there are places where the age of the hotel shows through (e.g. the hallways definitely show their age). Still, the rooms are fairly large, comfortable and clean. Wireless Internet is free in the room. The TV was an old, CRT set, but it worked well. There was an in-room coffee maker. The room was quiet during my stay. The digital climate control system is new. It worked well, though for cost-saving purposes it shuts off when you are out of the room (motion sensor). You have to give the room some time to return to a comfortable temperature when you come back. Service: The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. Location: The hotel is just outside downtown Napa (couple of minutes drive), basically at the beginning of the Silverado Trail. It is an excellent location for exploring both Napa and Sonoma. There is also a shopping center on the other side of the highway (Solscal Ave.) Value: I paid $150 (including taxes) per night. Parking and Internet were free. Given the prices of most accommodations around Napa, I found the Best Western Inn at the Vines to be a pretty good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Matty611
Reviews.Content: We spent a couple of days at this hotel and it was a great experience. The rooms were clean, quite, and the staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The location was convenient to both Sonoma and Napa. This hotel is an excellent value!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ddieter
Reviews.Content: We recently spent two nights at the Inn of the Vines Best Western Plus. The rooms were spacious, clean, and well appointed. The staff was extremely helpful and welcoming. We had reservations for the Wine Train and the hotel location was ideal- only about 1 1/2 miles away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: harpreet c
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a wonderful stay! great service and hospitality. We are looking forward to staying again!

Reviews.Title: “Great price and location. Close to everything in Napa!”
Reviews.Author: beepages
Reviews.Content: We spent four days at this hotel and it was a good experience. We wanted to visit Napa Valley but many on the inns and hotels are very expensive. We certainly were not planning to spend much time at the hotel and just wanted something comfortable and convenient. It is located a 5 minute drive from downtown Napa and 10 minutes away from the Wine Train Station. There are many things nearby if you need stuff. There is a DennyÂ´s next to the hotel and a Target, ApplebeeÂ´s, IHOP and many more fast food restaurants just across the road. Since we were traveling with kids it was good to have different options. The hotel is very basic but well-kept. The rooms are big and comfortable and so is the bathroom. There is a tiny pool and hot tub outside. The kids liked that. We enjoyed our experience there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and staff - recommend”
Reviews.Author: westcoast74
Reviews.Content: I came in late after a long drive from Vegas ending in a whole lot of highway exits and concentration to get to Napa! I was greeted by a friendly night staff who was expecting me, and (not sure of his name) made me feel more relaxed immediately. I even got a little welcome pack with a snack and water. That was much appreciated! Breakfast was not included, fruit and granola bars were out in the lobby. A hotel discount was offered at the friendly Denny's next door. My room was quiet and all 3 of the morning staff were incredibly helpful the next morning helping me map out my day of driving, and helping me choose and book my next hotels. The hotel is a convienent location, not too far off the main highway. Near all services and malls if needed.

Reviews.Title: “This was surprisingly luxurious for the price.”
Reviews.Author: steeleju
Reviews.Content: I have a different opinion of Best Westerns after staying at this hotel. Very, very nice accommodations for the price. I would definitely go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: KLungren_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Best Western Inn at the Vines in Napa to meet with my brother from Pennsylvania. He his wife and friends had all flown in for a half marathon. We really enjoyed our stay, got a upgrade to a King Suite with a coupon - no problem. Had our breakfast at the Denny's located at the hotel, great service and nice way to start our day. The staff was very helpful and pleasant. Will stay here again when I return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Wow-Great price for a great room in a very over-priced tourist area”
Reviews.Author: lsayre
Reviews.Content: Very nice motel on busy intersection, but rooms are located toward back of property so noise not too bad. Interior corridor access restricted w/card lock opened w/room key so w/level of additional security for single woman. Has elevator to 2nd and 3rd floors. Room spotless, clean, everything in great condition. Newfangled heat/AC controls w/instructions (thank goodness!) worked well. Shower w/shower massage-very nice touch. Was very comfortable stay. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time and enjoyed our stay. We will be back.”
Reviews.Author: LarryDeas
Reviews.Content: The service was impeccable, the room very clean, the staff extrememly helpful and very friendly, the coffee was hot and ready early, and the location is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay on a Hot day”
Reviews.Author: MELCOR
Reviews.Content: Stayed to night & enjoyed the accommodations. Good value & great location for wine touring & best of all it was doggy friendly! AC worked good & got good use out of the pool & hot tub. If you brought the hounds along this is a great choice. The room we had even had a small fenced yard! So not five star but it was to the dogs

Reviews.Title: “Just what we expected from previous reviews...”
Reviews.Author: CBC46
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on Trip Advisor, we decided to try The Inn at the Vines for 2 nights. The price was very reasonable for June and the place was sold out for the second night. The staff are friendly and welcoming. The rooms were clean and roomy, though ours was a bit dark. Our king first room assignment was on the second floor, but it was an adjoining room, so we asked for another room. We were told there are very few king rooms that don't have adjoining rooms, but we were given one on the first floor. We could hear the person in the room above us walking around, but that stopped at a reasonable hour. Our TV didn't get any channels above 13, so we couldn't view any premium channels. The evening desk clerk offered to have maintenance check the TV in the morning, but we were checking out and just told him to make note for future guests. Internet is free. This is a fine place for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money. met basic needs”
Reviews.Author: tran234
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights while in Napa. Rooms had the essentials (plus for microwave & fridge & free internet). Walls were thin bc we could here people walking around in the room (above us). Nice touch to have coffee, fruit, and granola bars at front desk in AM - we stopped there each morning. Nice central location bc able to get on Highway 29 or take Coombs to downtown Napa. In & Out Burger, Target, local grocery store were withing walking distance. Able to use room key for Denny's for discount. Staff (housekeeping, front desk) was great

Reviews.Title: “napa vally”
Reviews.Author: kingylee
Reviews.Content: stayed hear for 2 nights in April 2011. Plenty of free parking and good Swimming pool and hot tub. Nice hotel but you could hear people walking around upstairs and using bathrooms in the morning. hotel on busy road junction some traffic noice with windows open. hotel staff helpfull for booking taxis ect. next to a Dennys but not told room key will get you disscount only plastic cups in room for hot drinks

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: lakeluvr16
Reviews.Content: Wow! This was a Best Western so that is what we expected. There were 4 of us in one room and there was plenty of room, staff was wonderful, room was clean and the Denny's next door made it easy to eat breakfast. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “A good value”
Reviews.Author: DTBokor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one evening. It was nice, clean and the staff were friendly. We arrived very early to catch a wine tour before checking in. So we were very suprised that the staff member at the desk checked to see if she had a room available. Although there was not a room available we were impressed she even checked. I was a little concerned when I saw our room was near the vending area and entrance but it was not an issue. Once we were in our room their was no disturbance from either. The location is a little far from downtown Napa if you like to walk, the only downfall that we could see. If you do not mind eating at chains (i.e. applebee's, McDonalds) their are many different places to choose from in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: BDLS
Reviews.Content: The rooms are comfortable and the staff is helpful. A pool and patio setting to have drink or a snack before dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Polly018
Reviews.Content: We arrived early for check in by 2 hours and our allocated room wasn't ready but we were offered another (larger) room immediately. The reception staff were really helpful and friendly, booking taxis for us and ensuring they arrived on time. The hotel is comfortable, clean and teriffic value for money. It's ideally located for the Napa Valley Wine Train (a 5 minute taxi journey away). There is no restaurant but complimentary coffee, fruit and cereal bars were available in reception along with free internet access. There is a Denny's next door for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a reasonable cost”
Reviews.Author: Travelintrax
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 2 nights at this Inn. It is conveniently located to wine country at a price of approx. $134 per night. The staff was friendly and helpful with recommendations to area restaurants. Another bonus is the Denny's restaurant on the premises where we received a 15% discount on food purchases. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice room but quite a walk into Napa”
Reviews.Author: L_traveller101
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. The room was really nice and very spacious. No hot breakfast but fruit, cereal/granola bars and tea and coffee was available at reception in the mornings. The only criticism is that it is quite expensive for a chain hotel (but this is Napa) and it is about 1/2 hour walk down a busy road to get into the centre of Napa (where the wine train is etc).

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Evi319
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in the beginning of July. The hotel was very clean, the check in was very quick, the pool was small but nice, and the bed was comfortable. Another nice thing about this hotel was the climate control was easy to use and actually cooled the room. The location is good. The only complaint we had was the advertised 'continental breakfast' which turned out to be coffee and granola bars in the lobby. It also was advertised that the Denny's next door would provide a discount for guests who choose to go there instead but the discount was 10% and the restaurant was very marked up and not even a quality Denny's.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Overall Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Sunstoked
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its proximity to the Napa valley wineries and the good price. We were not disappointed. Downtown Napa was about a five minute drive and the wineries were about 15-20 minutes away. The room was a good size and comfortable, both literally and in decor. Also, it seemed that housekeeping did a thorough job. We were in a room facing the Denny's, which is on a main road, but we were surprised that the noise didn't carry to our room at all. Our only complaints (and they are a stretch) were that the tv in the room next door was about three times bigger than ours, and the bed seemed small for a queen. The front desk was very helpful in guiding us to some great wineries and they gave us coupons for buy one, get one free tastings or complementary tastings at a few places. The breakfast was small: granola bars, fruit and coffee. It made for a good snack, but its not the hearty breakfast you want before wine tasting (found out the hard way). There is also a grocery store and some fast food chains, across the street. Overall, a really nice experience and will definitely stay here again whenever I get the chance to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, but room was noisy.”
Reviews.Author: ethicka
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 101 which is one door away from the lobby during a tour of Napa. Thankfully the room was paid for with miles, because this hotel was exorbitantly expensive for what it was, which is a discount chain. The only thing exceptional about this hotel was the service. The staff was super friendly even including the cleaning staff who had a smile and hello when you walked by. Otherwise, bed was comfortable, shower had good pressure, and the desk had some nice plugs for electronics. There's not safe in the room for anything, but they will take your valuables at the desk. There's some decent coffee, granola bars, and assorted fruit in the morning on the left as you enter the lobby. Nothing special, but enough to get you out the door in the morning. PS 15 percent Denny's discount with your room key. If you're already spending money to be in Napa, though, you better be eating at some better places!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: ema050
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the BW for two nights and the hotel was great if you want something clean and with good service. We did ask for a room away from Denny's since we read reviews about the noise that comes from Denny, and our room was quiet. The parking lot was quiet and I thought the neighborhood was great with stores right across the street - Target, Ihop, etc. The pool is small, but we did not go swimming. The front desk gave us a bottle of wine since we had to wait 20 minutes. Even if they didn't offer us the wine, it would have been just fine, but it sure was a nice surprise. The room was spacious with a deck and clean. If you just need a place to stay without all the frills (since we just slept there), this is a great place to stay and easy access to wine country and sites. The price was reasonable too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price for touring the CA wine country”
Reviews.Author: ARTravelmamma
Reviews.Content: For us, this hotel was in a great location in proximity to going wine tasting. We spent two days going to Napa, Sonoma, Yontville, Rutherford and St. Helena. We also wanted to save money on our room to have more for traveling and shopping. We paid $100.00 including tax using Priceline. There is a shopping center across the street with fast food and chain restaurants, Target, etc. which is convenient. The room doors are exterior and the room a typical size for a motel. I thought for the size the furniture was nice and with plenty of drawers and counter space. We also found the room to be very clean (this is important to us). I would definitely recommend this motel/hotel to anyone visiting the Sonoma/ Napa Valley wine tasting region for a great headquarters.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: ChefAnnMt_Laurel_NJ
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located at the beginning of town, which is a great location to branch out from. They give you vouchers for a full breakfast at Denny's next door. Room was very clean and nicely decorated. The front desk gals were very helpful and gave me coupons for wineries. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not our first choice but very nice”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireTraveller12
Reviews.Content: We orignally wanted to stay elsewhere and tried two hotels but they were full so decided to stay here and were pleasantly surprised. Nice clean rooms and very friendly staff who recommended good restaurants and vineyards to visit. Certainly give this hotel a try.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't need the fridge to chill the wine.”
Reviews.Author: Aptos_CaEeyore
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and my wife's sister all headed up to Napa for a Spa treatment and some wine tasting. Because there were three of us we decided to book a suite at the Best Western at $160/night. The suite consists of a large downstairs sitting room with a fold out sofa bed and a smaller upstairs loft with a king size bed. The problems started as soon as we walked in the door, the staff hadn't turned the heat on prior to our arrival and the room was freezing. We turned on the heater full blast but the air coming out of it was barely warm and after two and a half hours my sister in law was still huddled in bed with her jacket and mittens on. The bedding on the sofa bed consisted of a sheet and one thin cotton "blanket". The hotel offered pay per view movies, but you can't access them using the remote control and there were no directions for what to do. After calling the front desk twice and getting no answer, I walked down to the lobby and told the young man(who appeared to be completely by himself) about our problems. He promised to bring us more blankets and gave me a phone number to call for the pay per view. I called but the automated directions made no sense and I gave up after waiting on hold for five minutes. When the front desk kid showed up with the blankets we had him call the pay per view number. After waiting on hold for about ten minutes he got hold of somebody but it turns out the movies are only shown at certain times and the one we wanted was already half way through so we gave up. We asked him if there was any way to get more heat out of the heater and he said somebody would take a look at it first thing in the morning. The room was fine except for the lack of heat and the young man at the front desk helped us as much as he was able, but the pay per view was a fiasco and the over all experience was below average.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan_68
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Napa valley area without having booked anything. We found this Best Western, but the price didn't match the quality. Fior 160 dollars a night, the rooms were basic. We were told these were the prices around Napa Valley, but we felt we let ourselves down by not booking early and choosing a better place for much less.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive, decent hotel in Napa”
Reviews.Author: kaplotz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights at the Best Western Inn at the Vines in Napa in Sept 2008. Unknowly, we booked a two story suite which was a pleasant surprise, especially at $149 a night. The main problem was that that suite faced the main road into Napa so the traffic noise was rather loud all night. Other than that one minor issue, the staff was very nice here and the hotel was clean. The hotel is located at the very south end of Napa, so it takes about 30 minutes to get all the way to Calistoga. It makes for a very scenic drive though!

Reviews.Title: “Painfully Average - Desperation Lodging”
Reviews.Author: 2old4travel
Reviews.Content: Now don't get me wrong; I love adventure as well as the next person but this Motel is not what one should consider unless there is no alternative. True, hospitality varies and a room should enclose the visitor and shelter the visitor from the outer world. To that degree, BW @ Vines works. Its open Patio, Pool and Whirlpool are useful to the traveler and charming to the visitor. It is well situated for the business traveler but the environment is not the best for the traveler. The embedded restaurant is a Denny's; which is popular with the local crowd. Visitors to the Motel get to share the parking lot with local characters. This facility is in the "Gateway" area of Napa; at the SOUTHEAST entry to the city. It is handy to Big Box stores like Home Depot, chain and fast food dining, new and used car dealers, Gas Stations and to better parts of the world.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap place to sleep in Napa”
Reviews.Author: bntzmimi
Reviews.Content: The closer you book your trip the more willing the hotel is to negotiate the price and stay length. Overall a cheap place to stay for a night or two. It's pretty clean. Hallways are kinda old smelling and it looks worn, but the staff was pleasant and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly Hallways but Everything Else o.k.”
Reviews.Author: skeets22
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for families. The room was decorated really nice and the Denny's breakfast was great. They also heat their pool and keep the jacuzzi at a very nice temperature. The only complaint would be the hallways. They smelled like body odor but once in the room you are fine. The person at the front desk said it was the air freshener they spray but it was really bad. Don't let that deter you though, everything else was great. The price should be about 15% less though. Note that this location is at the entrance of the valley so if you want the wine country experience you might want to check out the Best Western on Calistoga. Once last thing--they charge me almost $3 for a call within the same area code. I should have used my cell.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: hungryhippie
Reviews.Content: This place was better than I expected. The staff was friendly, there was free high speed wireless access, the room was clean, and it is located really close to the center of Napa. Its not a high-end hotel by any measure, but if you are looking for a decent hotel in a very expensive area, this place is it.

Reviews.Title: “Facilities Need Work”
Reviews.Author: tberry1
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here during a weekend of wine tasting and bike riding. The room was sufficiently clean and well-kept and the staff was friendly, but the hotel was not without problems. For starters, the building has to be the worst insulated place I've ever stayed. We could hear every last thing the people upstairs were doing. Just walking around make the entire ceiling creak and crack. It sounded like they were going to crash through the ceiling. HORRIBLE building. The mini-fridge was also in need of repair. It would suddenly make this loud, high-pitched noise that sounded like a kitten was dying. It was so annoying we had to unplug it. Finally, although it is advertised that each room comes with free internet access, (either wireless or through an ethernet port, depending on the room), ours came with neither. We even asked the concierge to check it out, and after 15 minutes he conceded that our room simply did not have access. Finally, the shower was an adventure in itself, with wildly fluctuating hot and cold water without notice. Don't get me wrong, the room was clean and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Also, the breakfast voucher at the attached Denny's saved us some money. In summary, for the price I think that the BW Inn at the Vines should invest a little money back into its facilities.

Reviews.Title: “It's what I expected...”
Reviews.Author: Jorge21
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is fine and rooms are comfortable for a one star hotel. To be honest I didn't expect anything different. What I didn't expect was the rude and loud service from the gal behind the counter(she even acted like management...go figure), it left a bad taste in my mouth that is still present today. The night guy (Jeremy I believe) was very nice and helpful which helped change my feelings about the place. The prices are a bit steep, so the next go around I might spend my money at a bed and breakfast instead.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: lhabr56
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel/motel stay I can ever remember having. The bed wa so hard I might as well have slept on the floor, no extra pillows either. The noise from the upstairs rooms and the parking lot was so loud it was scary. The tv reception was poor. The water in the shower went from scalding to cold and back without warning. The A/C unit would not stay on, so the room was unbearably warm. My complaint to the front desk resulted in an apology (nice, but big deal) and an offer for extra points if I was a member of their program ( I'm not). The room was incredibly overpriced to boot!

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: McAZ
Reviews.Content: We were a group of three couples in our fifties who were on a 10 day wine trip in Northern California. We spent three nights at the Best Western Inn at the Vines. It was clean, breakfast was convenient and the location was fine. The best part of the stay was the help we received from the front desk by Bridget. She was more than willing to answer questions, make suggestions for things to do, places to visit, and she offered restaurants choices.

Reviews.Title: “What You See is What You Get”
Reviews.Author: fgaaron
Reviews.Content: The reviews on this Best Western are all over the range of scores, but we all stayed at the same motel. Go figure! This is a basic services motel in an upscale county (Napa). Don't come here expecting frills and fancy decor. And what's wrong with eating breakfast at Dennys? We used the coupons and our breakfast cost about $2 plus tip. If you are here to tour the wine country there are probably better places to stay. If you are just looking for a place in Napa to spend a night or two please give this place your consideration. We arrived here on our way to Sonoma County and needed a place to stay for 1 night. The Best Western suited our needs. Our room was clean and the furniture was in good shape. I can't speak to the ammenities since we just used the Best Western as a place to sleep, clean up and hit the road.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but noisy location”
Reviews.Author: rszasz
Reviews.Content: Date of trip : May 22 -25,2007 Reviewer : Robert and Lavinia from Toronto,Canada We have stayed (3) nights in a room with two queen beds on 3rd floor of building A . We had a bit of issue with one of the Front desk receptionist which was noisy and nervous during our check in . All the other's at front desk during our stay were nice and helpful. The room was very nicely decorated and very large with fridge and microwave. The hotel location is convenient as it is easy to drive into downtown Napa and easy to drive to Napa and Sonoma wineries. The breakfast : two eggs,meat ,toast and coffe or $2.50 credit at Denny's is included with the nightly rate. The breakfast was not too generous but it was o.k. (better than nothing) The computer with free internet and printer was a bonus for us.The main problem we had was with the noise from the road during the night . We could not get a similar size room far from the road which would have make our stay more pleasent and we might have extended our stay by one additional night. In summary it was a good value but it would have been a better one if we would have got a room in a quite location.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bab250
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at this hotel. The beds/linens had recently been upgraded and looked more like a 3 star room. The front desk was very helpful and informative. It's about a 2 mile venture to downtown Napa. Although I was not impressed with the continental breakfast (coupons for Denny's), I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here.”
Reviews.Author: BaltimoreMargaret
Reviews.Content: When I called to inquire about breakfast, nothing was said about this inn being connected to a Denny's. Going to a noisy Denny's would be at the bottom of my list. Had I known this I would not have booked. The hotel is on a busy street across from McDonald's and Home Depot. The hotel has zero ambiance and is a little long in the tooth - has definitely seen better days. We were given a room next to the entrance door to our floor - opening and shutting all night. Our sink did not drain. Some lightbulbs were out. I do not recommend this inn. There are so many other places in Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal in the Valley”
Reviews.Author: yaffer
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times, on business and on vacation. The staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful. The rooms are furnished nicely and well equipped. For the price you can't beat this place. I recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a bargain and nice place to stay. There are plenty extremely nice hotels in Napa, but you'll pay far more than you will at the Inn at the Vines.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Place to Stay (inexpensive)”
Reviews.Author: mini
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in July. We had not made reservations in advance, so the only room available was the suite. It is a very large and comfortable room. The room has a large table (6 chairs), sofa, several other big sitting chairs, tv, etc. Upstairs is a large master bedroom with king size bed, tv, comfortble chairs, etc. The only downside is the bathroom is downstairs and the stairs up/down from the master bedroom are many. As such, to stay in the room, you need to be comfortable to climb stairs (we were....but it is a factor to consider if you are not.). The place was quite spacious. If you wanted to come with another couple to Napa and do it relatively inexpensively, you could rent the room next door, use the common living room area, and have the mater bedroom upstairs. All in all, it would make for a wonderful stay. They do have a swimming pool (small) and spa; area to sit outside in the sun. Its "small" but everyone who went there enjoyed the area. It comes with breakfast (eggs/meat/coffee or tea/etc.) breakfast at the Denny's next door. Also, you get 20% off Denny's bill ilf you eat there at another meal. Very friendly place....its not the "ritz" but its a fine place to stay if you want inexpensive place to stay in Napa. its about a mile drive to downtown Napa. (If you come without a car, there is a rental car place - Enterprise) within a couple minutes walk of the Best Western.

Reviews.Title: “Dark and outdated”
Reviews.Author: MissMyDog
Reviews.Content: The room was very dark with a fence that blocked light from the slider door. I think it was an attempt to make a private patio. The room lighting was terrible too. Room was ok. Would not stay here again. The location was ok if you are going to wineries. Price was good. They give you a coupon for a free light breakfast at the Denny's next door, or you can use it as $ off your purchase there. The Denny's was so smoky and outdated. Would not recommend it either.

Reviews.Title: “Served the purpose...”
Reviews.Author: linlo
Reviews.Content: We just stayed here as part of a large group. Actually, it was very clean and the rooms were spacious. I believe the room we were in had been updated fairly recently. There was a small refrigerator, microwave, and coffee pot. Didn't use any of these, but nice to have them there. We got coupons for a $2.50 breakfast at the next door Denny's (you could "upgrade" if you wanted to). Beds were comfortable; the views were non existant, but we were only there to sleep and clean up anyway. This is no wine country bed and breakfast, but I have stayed in much worse places. The only slip up was when all our group key cards got de-gaussed and no one could get in their room. That was remedied pretty fast. All-in-all, I was pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: bklynbsd
Reviews.Content: This particular Best Western is certainly clean, and in-room high-speed 'net access is convenient, but that's all it has going for it. Ignore for a moment the lack of a fitness center and the sub-standard Denny's that seems to be the only viable dining option within a couple miles. (It's surrounded by shopping centers and fast food restaurants.) When returning from a meeting in Benicia, I called the front desk, spelled out my exact location, after which I received what turned out to be incorrect directions, taking me over two hours out of my way, well past midnight. I called again, explained what happened, and the late night desk clerk, Josh, just laughed and said it happens all the time. Needless to say I was furious, and Josh was no help at all. Since I only come to the area for business, I will never stay at this location again.

Reviews.Title: “It's "Okay"”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The good points: it's relatively inexpesive, it was clean, and the service was good. The bad: it's close to a heavily used road (think noise), and its not quaint or luxurious. The brochure claims that you get a complimentary Breakfast. But what they actually give you is $2.50 off your breakfast at Dennys. This basically covered the cost of our coffee. I don't think Dennys has a breakfast on the menu for $2.50.

Reviews.Title: “Most Affordable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff was nice and friendly. We got a second-floor room w/ a balcony (away from Dennys) and it was the best room in the place. It was nice and quiet and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Moderate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: M&HWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Inn at the Vines for 2 nights in February 2004. The hotel is situated on a very busy street. The room was basic and clean. We had a ground floor room which made it feel more like a "motel" because our view was of the parking lot. Free breakfast at Denny's was a nice change from continental breakfast offered at most hotels and included coffee, eggs, bacon/sausage, toast. We loved Napa Valley and if we were to return, we would try to stay at a quieter hotel with a nice view of the vineyards. We toured many vineyards and enjoyed them all (Robert Mondavi, Beringer, Sterling, V.Sattui).

Reviews.Title: “In the 'Hood'...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Sandwiched between the highway and the State Mental Hospital. Lots of sleezy foot traffic and teenagers in the parking lot at all hours. Traffic and noise from the room above made for sleepless nights. The rooms were clean, the staff accommodating. Breakfast at Denny's was a nice feature. There are no "Vines" anywhere near this Inn! Would not stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Inn at the Vines
HotelInfo.Address: 100 Soscol Ave, Napa, CA 94559
